content:
To a stirring methanolic solution (10 mL) containing copper(II) bromide (44.6 mg, 0.2 mmol) was added dropwise a methanolic solution (10 mL) of HL1 (38.4 mg, 0.2 mmol). Then a solution of ammonium thiocyanate (15.2 mg, 0.2 mmol) dissolved in 5 mL water was added to the reaction mixture. The stirring was continued for half an hour and filtered. The filtrate was kept undisturbed at room temperature for a week. Deep blue crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained on slow evaporation of the solvent. Crystals were isolated by filtration and dried in air. Yield 63% with respect to the HL1. Analysis calculated for C12H15CuN3OS: C, 46.1; H, 4.8; N, 13.4%; found: C, 46.3; H, 4.9; N, 13.3%.

Synthesis of [CuBrL<sup>2</sup>(<italic>μ</italic><sub>1,1</sub>-N<sub>3</sub>)]<sub>2</sub> (<bold>2</bold>)

To a stirring methanolic solution (10 mL) containing copper(II) bromide (44.6 mg, 0.2 mmol) was added dropwise a methanolic solution (10 mL) of L2 (35.4 mg, 0.2 mmol). Then a solution of sodium azide (13.0 mg, 0.2 mmol) dissolved in 5 mL water was added to the reaction mixture. The stirring was continued for half an hour and filtered. The filtrate was kept undisturbed at room temperature for a week. Deep blue crystals of 2 suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained on slow evaporation of the solvent. Crystals were isolated by filtration and dried in air. Yield 51% with respect to the L2. Analysis calculated for C20H30Br2Cu2N12: C, 33.1; H, 4.2; N, 23.2%; found: C, 33.0; H, 4.2; N, 23.4%.
clean_text:
Synthesis of [CuL1(μ1,3-NCS)]n (1)

To a stirring methanolic solution (10 mL) containing copper(II) bromide (44.6 mg, 0.2 mmol) was added dropwise a methanolic solution (10 mL) of HL1 (38.4 mg, 0.2 mmol). Then a solution of ammonium thiocyanate (15.2 mg, 0.2 mmol) dissolved in 5 mL water was added to the reaction mixture. The stirring was continued for half an hour and filtered. The filtrate was kept undisturbed at room temperature for a week. Deep blue crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained on slow evaporation of the solvent. Crystals were isolated by filtration and dried in air. Yield 63% with respect to the HL1. Analysis calculated for C12H15CuN3OS: C, 46.1; H, 4.8; N, 13.4%; found: C, 46.3; H, 4.9; N, 13.3%.

Synthesis of [CuBrL2(μ1,1-N3)]2 (2)

To a stirring methanolic solution (10 mL) containing copper(II) bromide (44.6 mg, 0.2 mmol) was added dropwise a methanolic solution (10 mL) of L2 (35.4 mg, 0.2 mmol). Then a solution of sodium azide (13.0 mg, 0.2 mmol) dissolved in 5 mL water was added to the reaction mixture. The stirring was continued for half an hour and filtered. The filtrate was kept undisturbed at room temperature for a week. Deep blue crystals of 2 suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained on slow evaporation of the solvent. Crystals were isolated by filtration and dried in air. Yield 51% with respect to the L2. Analysis calculated for C20H30Br2Cu2N12: C, 33.1; H, 4.2; N, 23.2%; found: C, 33.0; H, 4.2; N, 23.4%.
